channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Opinion: The most unequal city is...?
item.description: Last year, after CNN readers voted for me to do a story on income inequality, I spent two weeks reporting from what was then the "most unequal place in America": East Carroll Parish, Louisiana. It's a tiny patch of land on the western bank of the Mississippi River -- home to a beautiful oxbow lake called Lake Providence. That lake, I found, is a stark barrier between rich and poor -- and a fitting microcosm for inequality across the nation.

item.title: Philippines braces for typhoon
item.description: The Philippines, still scarred by last year's devastating Super Typhoon Haiyan, braced itself for another potentially catastrophic storm, with millions rushing to evacuate, stock up on supplies and take cover.

item.title: China to end harvesting inmate organs
item.description: Like many Chinese, Beijing bank clerk Zhou Keran shudders when asked if he would donate his organs should he die.

item.title: Opinion: Why Barkley is clueless
item.description: There is nothing wrong with professional athletes expressing their opinions about social or political issues. Just because you slip on a helmet or swing a racquet doesn't mean you don't have the right to voice an opinion on politics, the economy, faith or any other issue in America.

item.title: Man's encounter with cop goes viral
item.description: A man was stopped by police for having his "hands in pockets" after it was reported on a 911 call.

item.title: Obama family lights National Tree
item.description: Thousands of people gather to watch the first family light the National Christmas Tree in President's Park.

item.title: Opinion: Outrage of 'virginity tests'
item.description: Like thousands of other female applicants to Indonesia's National Police, 24-year-old Sari (not her real name) submitted to the mandatory "virginity test" that the authorities require women -- but not men -- to take as part of the application process.

item.title: Opinion: Should boss email after work?
item.description: As a frequent traveler to Germany, I can't help but compare it to the United States. At first, I admired its new architecture. Then I became fascinated with how many different recycling bins line the streets. Lately, I've been marveling at the country's work-life balance.

item.title: Carson: Yep, U.S. like Nazi Germany
item.description: Neurosurgeon Ben Carson stood by his controversial comparison of the United States to Nazi Germany in an interview with CNN's Wolf Blitzer on Wednesday.

item.title: Rock keyboardist dead at 69
item.description: Ian McLagan, a fun-loving keyboardist who played on records by such artists as the Rolling Stones, Lucinda Williams, Bruce Springsteen and his own bands -- the Small Faces and its successor, the Faces -- died Wednesday, according to a statement from his record label, Yep Roc Records. He was 69.

item.title: The next James Bond film is...
item.description: The past is new again for agent 007: The next James Bond film will be called "Spectre."

item.title: Actor sings THIS for Taylor Swift
item.description: Billy Eichner loves Taylor Swift so much that he wrote a song for her. Hopefully she'll be inspired to make it her own!

item.title: Lady Gaga's revealing interview
item.description: When Lady Gaga speaks of young women being abused in the music industry, she speaks from experience.

item.title: NBC takes Mariah live. Oops
item.description: Mariah Carey is known for her five-octave voice, her slinky dresses and her many hits, including "All I Want for Christmas is You."

item.title: Happy 50th 'Rudolph'
item.description: The longest-running holiday special still has a very shiny nose.

item.title: Lynx attacks her in neighborhood
item.description: A Siberian lynx attacked a woman who was trying to feed the cat in a Georgia neighborhood.

item.title: Dog falls through thin ice but ...
item.description: One firefighter came to the rescue after a golden retriever fell through thin ice on a lake. WMTW reports.

item.title: How diet soda confuses your body
item.description: Soda makers want to cut the number of calories you're drinking each year. The big three -- Coke, Pepsi and Dr Pepper -- have all pledged to reduce the number of beverage calories Americans are consuming by 20% over the next decade.

item.title: Orion's first test flight a success
item.description: NASA's Orion capsule splashes down in the Pacific Ocean after its first, unmanned, two-orbit test flight that begins what the space agency hopes is a new era of manned space exploration leading to Mars.

item.title: Orion -- NASA's next giant leap
Opinion: NASA's Mars milestone
item.description: Everywhere you look, there is renewed interest in space. Two of the top grossing movies of the past two years were "Gravity" and "Interstellar," while recent real-life space dramas have been even more fascinating than fiction.

item.title: Actress died from blunt force injuries
item.description: Actress Misty Upham, whose body was found in October along a river in suburban Seattle, died from blunt force injuries to her head and torso, the King County Medical Examiner said Thursday.

item.title: New Cosby accuser comes forward
item.description: A new accuser says she knows 12 women who were raped by Cosby. CNN reached out to Cosby's attorney but has not heard back.

item.title: Cop who shot boy called immature
item.description: Timothy Loehmann resigned from another police force in 2012 after a supervisor described him as "distracted and weepy," and "emotionally immature."

item.title: DOJ: Excessive force used
item.description: Attorney General Eric Holder discusses findings from an investigation into whether Cleveland police used excessive force.

item.title: Hagel not at successor's unveiling
item.description: President Barack Obama will announce Friday that Ash Carter is his pick to replace outgoing-Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel, the White House confirms.

item.title: George Bush picks Jeb over Hillary
item.description: George W. Bush might have developed a brotherly relationship with Bill Clinton -- but he's still picking his actual brother, Jeb, over Clinton's wife, Hillary, in a potential 2016 presidential match-up.

item.title: Rand Paul's surprise move on ISIS
item.description: Sen. Rand Paul surprised members of the Foreign Relations Committee on Thursday when he threatened to force a vote on a declaration of war against ISIS as an amendment to an unrelated bill dealing with clean drinking water around the world.

item.title: Opinion: Romney has news for GOP
item.description: It can't be. The Republican Party's wise new sage on immigration is ... Mitt Romney?

item.title: Jazz and politics in the 'zombie runoff'
item.description: Maybe she meant to, maybe she didn't, but Mary Landrieu reached straight for the encyclopedia of Things Losing Candidates Say.

item.title: Women on sub filmed in shower
item.description: Navy criminal investigators are looking into who secretly filmed female officers of a submarine crew while they were showering and changing clothes onboard the boat's unisex bathrooms, a U.S. Navy official confirms to CNN.

item.title: Boys dial 911 in search for Santa
item.description: Two brothers in Wisconsin get more than they bargained for when they call 911 looking for Santa Claus. WTMJ reports.

item.title: Video captures dramatic raid
item.description: CNN's Becky Anderson examines new details and motivations that may be behind the Abu Dhabi mall attack.

item.title: Huge swastika found at bottom of pool
item.description: Civil Police in Brazil say one of their helicopters made a startling discovery -- a huge swastika in the bottom of a swimming pool.

item.title: Glitch drops gas prices to 29 cents
item.description: Word spread fast in Natchitoches, Louisiana, when a technical glitch dropped gas prices to just 29 cents. KSLA reports

item.title: Elgin Marble loaned to Russia
item.description: The British Museum is lending one of the controversial Elgin Marbles to a foreign museum for the first time, it announced Friday.

item.title: Kids 'robbed of their innocence'
item.description: In Guatemala, Juan Pablo Romero Fuentes opened the doors of his house to give education and a safe haven to children.

item.title: Chokehold death protests spread
item.description: Protesters chanted, blocked traffic and demanded change after the chokehold death of Eric Garner.

item.title: Eric Garner's neighbors talk
item.description: On a chilly morning after thousands took to the streets to protest yet another grand jury's refusal to indict a white police officer for killing an unarmed black man, tourists vied for spots on the Staten Island Ferry to photograph the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.

item.title: A 'model officer'
item.description: Conflicting portraits have emerged of the police officer at the center of the controversy surrounding the death of Eric Garner in Staten Island during an attempted arrest in July.

item.title: Here's what a chokehold is
item.description: Martin Savidge spends the day finding out what a chokehold is and why police use it.

item.title: Garner's mom: It was a thrill kill
item.description: Eric Garner's mother says the officer put her son in a chokehold because of his size and not because of race.

item.title: Opinion: Build cops who don't kill?
item.description: The grand jury decisions not to indict officers in the killing of Michael Brown in Ferguson and the killing of Eric Garner on Staten Island have been made. Unsurprisingly, some people agree with them and others do not.

item.title: 2014: The year in pictures
item.description: Photo gallery: 2014 in pictures

item.title: Look at me! Selfies of the year
What a shot! 75 sports moments
Ellsberg: He's a hero
item.description: Daniel Ellsberg tells CNN's Don Lemon that NSA leaker Edward Snowden showed courage, has done an enormous service.

item.title: Inside the palace of a dictator
item.description: In late 1989 the carefully constructed edifice of communism in Eastern Europe started crumbling in a wave of popular upheavals with a speed that took everyone by surprise.

item.title: ISIS turned city to a 'morbid playground'
item.description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh ventures inside the besieged city of Kobani to speak to those who refuse to leave their homes.

item.title: The week in 35 photos
Gone for 2 years, soldier surprises sis
item.description: An airman surprised his little sister at school with a special visit. CNN affiliate WFIE has more.

item.title: Dangerous 'fake pot' for sale
item.description: CNN's Will Ripley explores Japan's growing synthetic marijuana problem.

item.title: Game day in South? No T-shirts, please
item.description: If you're heading to a football game on a fall weekend in the South, your game-day closet is filled with dresses, blazers, button-downs and even suits in your team's signature color.

item.title: No more 'weird buildings' for China
item.description: China's skylines could look a lot more uniform in the years to come, if a statement by a Beijing official is to believed.

item.title: Jennifer Lawrence's song hits charts
item.description: Jennifer Lawrence isn't just an Oscar-winning actress. She's now a chart-climbing singer, too.

item.title: Hillary Clinton tribute song backfires
item.description: Hunky cowboy croons for Hillary, critics crack up. CNN's Jeanne Moos gives us an earful.

item.title: The parents who canceled Christmas
item.description: John and Lisa Henderson of Hurricane, Utah, had finally had enough of their little hurricanes. For months, they'd tried to teach their sons to stop being disrespectful and acting entitled.

item.title: Meet the world's first 1,000 mph car
item.description: What has a jet engine, a rocket booster and travels on a set of aluminum wheels? It could hit the land speed record of 1,000 mph.

item.title: Actor's hilarious 'Jeopardy!' video
item.description: Actor Joseph Gordon-Levitt appeared on "Jeopardy!" when he was 16, and boy was he excited to be there.

item.title: Extreme hunts for beautiful places
item.description: Despite the many challenges, extreme hikers seek thrills and extraordinary views.

item.title: Caught on camera: Yacht vs. bridge
item.description: A drawbridge collapses on a yacht being towed during a heavy storm. WSVN reports.

item.title: Rave your way to work in the morning?
item.description: Bored with boot-camp, or sick of spinning? Growing numbers are getting their kicks out of pre-work rave parties as the way to shed calories and gain a natural high.

item.title: 100 years of beauty in 70 seconds
item.description: Cut.com has created a time lapse of a model getting her hair and makeup done to match every decade from 1910 to 2010.

item.title:
Helping children
cope with loss
item.description: When a child suddenly loses a loved one, the emotional wounds can take years to heal. To help them through it, Annette March-Grier started a support group for them and their families.

item.title: Blastoff to splashdown in 4½ hours
item.description: NASA's new Orion spacecraft lifted off today on an uncrewed test flight that begins what the space agency hopes is a new era of space exploration, including sending a human to Mars.

item.title:
Helping children
cope with loss
item.description: When a child suddenly loses a loved one, the emotional wounds can take years to heal. To help them through it, Annette March-Grier started a support group for them and their families.

item.title: Violence, grief 'are directly connected'
item.description: Annette March-Grier provides a space for children to recover from the death of a loved one at home and learn how to cope.

item.title: Celebs to pay tribute
item.description: Presenters at this year's "CNN Heroes: An All-Star Tribute" include Benedict Cumberbatch, Taye Diggs, John Leguizamo, Christina Hendricks, Kelly Ripa, comedian Kathy Griffin, Morgan Spurlock and Questlove.

item.title: Meet the top 10 CNN Heroes
item.description: They protect lions, teach music to injured soldiers and open new worlds to autistic youth.

item.title: Eric Garner
item.description: If the color were removed from the boundless images of protests on America's streets over the last two nights, they might be mistaken for black-and-white photos of the struggle for civil rights in the 1960s.

item.title: Cleveland police
item.description: Above a vehicle bay at one of the Cleveland Division of Police's district stations hangs a sign that reads, "forward operating base," implying the station is in war zone.

item.title: Timothy Loehmann
item.description: Nearly two years before he shot and killed a 12-year-old who had an air gun, Cleveland Police Officer Timothy Loehmann resigned from another police job after a supervisor described him as "distracted and weepy" and "emotionally immature."

item.title: Typhoon Hagupit
item.description: The Philippines, still scarred by last year's devastating Super Typhoon Haiyan, braced itself for another potentially catastrophic storm, with millions rushing to evacuate, stock up on supplies and take cover.

item.title: Navy investigation
item.description: Navy criminal investigators are looking into who secretly filmed female officers of a submarine crew while they were showering and changing clothes onboard the boat's unisex bathrooms, a U.S. Navy official confirms to CNN.

item.title: Christmas
item.description: They are the parents who canceled Christmas.

item.title: 2014: The year in pictures
item.description: Photo gallery: 2014 in pictures

item.title: 75 amazing sports moments from 2014
Look at me! Selfies of the year
The week in 35 photos
Life in an 'urban millennium'
item.description: Take one look at these images and you experience a range of city-life emotions.
